subject: Medicine
title: Antivirals and Antibiotic Resistance
description: A quick win: understand Antivirals and Antibiotic Resistance.

hook.text: Antibiotics saved the 20th century. Antibiotic resistance may define the 21st.

buildup.text: Bacteria evolve resistance when antibiotics are overused. Resistant strains survive and multiply.

discovery.text: Superbugs like MRSA resist multiple drugs. Some infections are now untreatable with any existing antibiotic.

twist.text: 80% of antibiotics in the US are used in livestock farmingâ€”not medicineâ€”accelerating resistance.

climax.text: Without new antibiotics or stewardship, routine surgeries and minor infections could become deadly again.

punchline.text: Misusing antibiotics is breeding unstoppable bacteria.

quiz.question: What drives most antibiotic resistance?
options: Overuse of antibiotics in medicine and livestock farming
Viruses that destroy antibiotics in the bloodstream
Patients completing their full course of treatment
